organized.title: How Outsourced Teams Are Organized
organized.description: We provide clients with well organized development teams. As a rule, teams include 2-5 front-end developers, including a team leader, 1-2 QA engineers and a project manager.
organized.firstParagraph: When required, we can also assemble a team including back-end developers and systems analysts. In order to provide lean and efficient results, we sometimes divide functionality and employ several teams on larger projects.
organized.secondParagraph: From the client side, the team is usually joined by a product manager, designer and sometimes others. This can cause the lines between processes and teams to blur.
organized.footer: As a result, we cooperate closely with other client teams, with a clear understanding of responsibilities and transparency of processes.

scrumban.title: Scrumban
scrumban.description: We work with Agile methodologies, but do not blindly follow a particular doctrine.
scrumban.text: We use a mix of scrum and kanban, employing weekly sprints that are convenient for clients.
scrumban.text_2: In a classic scrum, at the end of a sprint a set of functionality is rolled out for production. Our weekly sprints, on the other hand, are fixed agreements on a certain amount of work that must be completed within a given timeframe. For example, we may complete some features, but testing could be scheduled and completed in the next sprint.

review.title: Code review
review.description: To control code quality, we employ a code-review process that the whole development team participates in, with specific rules.
review.text: For example, each pull request must be approved by at least two developers. Only after approval can the code be put into a stable branch. In code review, we focus on business logic, code readability, architecture and APIs.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.square: We work on an hourly basis. For this purpose we have developed our own time tracker that helps us pay salaries and generate client reports.
transparency.circle: We provide weekly reports so that clients are always aware of the current workload and can adjust the process. We can generate reports in various formats on request: by task, project, working day, specialist, sprint, etc.
transparency.arc: All documentation is automatically generated according to a template, which minimizes the risk of errors.
transparency.triangle: We have a dedicated manager who is responsible for the documentation and promptly assists with any questions.
